stadium.name: The Prismatic Pavilion
stadium.description: A massive, permanent, open-air fairground pavilion built on stilts over the Starlight Lagoon. The field is a chaotic mix of colorful stage-planks, constantly surrounded by the Prismatic Troupe's performers.

stats.pregame_ritual: Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Staring at their reflection in a bucket of water until they feel 'ready'.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Staring intently at their gauntlets, as if for the first time.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Trying to start a 'slow clap' with the audience before the game has begun.

stadium.name: The Su'akour Bowl
stadium.description: A crude, rowdy stadium built within the half-finished, black-stone walls of the warlord Su'akour's abandoned fortress. The stands are crumbling ruins, and the entire arena perpetually stinks of the nearby sulfur marshes.

stats.pregame_ritual: Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Washing their hands with dirt.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.
Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.
Staring at a single blade of grass until their eyes water.
Wiping a teammate's sweat onto their own forehead.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.

preGame:
# üéôÔ∏è PLAYOFF FEVER IN OSTERRA! Hello there, sports fans, and welcome to the greatest spectacle on the plane! I'm Nok the Corrupter, and boy-oh-boy, do we have a real humdinger for you tonight! It's Game One of the Best-of-3 series between The Brimstone Fire Eaters and The Starlight Bazaar Bizarres! We are live from The Prismatic Pavilion, where the stilts are creaky and the water is deep. Can you smell that? It's not just the lagoon splash, it's the smell of playoff blood! 

Now, look at those Fire Eaters! Nigel Rothmuller is over there on the sidelines reciting weather rhymes like a regular town crier, trying to predict if the sulfur marshes have followed them here! And would you look at Nachison Icken? She's got her boots on the wrong feet again! Talk about a tactical advantage‚Äîhow can the defense know where you're going if your toes are pointing the wrong way? It's genius, I tell you! 

But don't count out the Bizarres! Quintessa Austine is already trying to get a slow clap going with the audience, though it looks more like he's just swatting flies. And Gagliano Tallbott? He's currently telling jokes to the leather troll head! I hope that head has a sense of humor, or it's going to be a long night for the ball! Kython and his Prismatic Troupe are everywhere, and I swear I saw Caenis the Fatebreaker looking like she's about to break more than just an oath tonight! Let's get to the violence! üèüÔ∏è‚ú®
postGame:
# üèÜ THE BIZARRES STRIKE FIRST! üèÜ 

Holy Moly, what a start to the playoffs! If you like your sports with a side of blunt-force trauma and a splash of lagoon water, you came to the right place! The Starlight Bazaar Bizarres have taken Game One with a score of 2 to 0, and they did it while turning the field into a regular infirmary! 

The action started fast and furious! Lowson Hersh of the Fire Eaters didn't waste any time, tackling Milo Nelie so hard the poor fellow had to be carted off before he even knew the game had started! Talk about a warm welcome to the post-season! But the Bizarres aren't just performers; they're brawlers! Bush Heiner showed Orlina Jerrine exactly what she thought of his bird-calling rituals by sending him straight to the dirt! 

Possession was bouncing around like a greased pig! We saw interceptions by Oona Jane and Glassman Solley, but nobody could keep a grip on that slimy troll head. Every time someone tried to make a move, they were met with a face full of steel! Bollinger Susette sent Kristin Kronfeld to the sidelines, but the Bizarres didn't blink. Demp Chet stepped up and absolutely leveled Selimah Tully! I haven't seen a hit that clean since Sir Tanos tried to stab me in the Demon Prison! 

Then came the play of the game! Kristin Kronfeld, clearly recovered from that earlier tackle, lined up from Center Field and let fly! The troll head sailed through the air like a comet, right through the goal for a massive 2-point shoot! The crowd at the Prismatic Pavilion went wild‚Äîor maybe that was just the sound of someone falling into the lagoon! Either way, the scoreboard lit up like a festival! 

At halftime, the healers were busy, and Raphael Miyasawa was seen whispering sweet nothings to her biceps. It must have worked because everybody came back for more! But the second half was a defensive slugfest. The Fire Eaters tried to get something going, but they just couldn't find the basket. Campball Fink took two shots from Center Field, and both of them missed! Maybe she should've stomped in a muddier puddle before the game! 

The violence didn't let up, though! Milo Nelie returned to the field only to immediately take his revenge on Oona Jane, and Nigel Rothmuller sent Willa Lois packing right after! It was a regular revolving door of KOs! Even Aggri Cookie got in on the action, flattening Bollinger Susette just when the Fire Eaters were trying to mount a comeback. 

Late in the game, the Bizarres' defense was like a wall of iron. Pompei Hephzipa sent Glassman Solley to the dirt, and Melesa Zelten made a spectacular run toward the goal that had the fans on their feet! Gagliano Tallbott followed suit with another advance, keeping the pressure on until the final whistle blew. 

The Fire Eaters were left staring at their own boots‚Äîprobably because they're still on the wrong feet‚Äîwondering what hit them! The Bizarres take a 1-0 lead in this Best-of-3 series! If the Fire Eaters don't find a way to score in Game Two, they'll be heading to the loser's bracket faster than a fey circus leaving town when the tax collector arrives! 

Take that, you so-called heroes of Eponore! You could learn a thing or two about grit from these players! They don't need magic swords or divine providence; they just need a heavy club and a lack of self-preservation! 

Final Score: The Brimstone Fire Eaters 0 - The Starlight Bazaar Bizarres 2! We'll see you for Game Two! Don't forget to wash the sulfur out of your hair on the way out! üéáüèí
